fields.headline: Celebrity etiquette
fields.bodyText: The A-list cannot be loved by all the people all of the time. Au contraire, the bigger and better and more gorgeous one gets, the more likely one is to inspire antipathy. Scathing hatred is the flipside of mindless adoration and the Unknowns are constantly vacillating between the two. Currently, however, the best sort of wrath a famous person can incur is the wrath of God.When God 's cross with you, you know you 're big. Just ask Jessica Simpson, who 's inspired much anger among the Christian groups who once admired her for her virginity and God-fearing ways, but who are now appalled by her behaviour and attire in the v raunchy These Boots are Made for Walking video. And also SpongeBob SquarePants, the six-year-old cartoon character whose tendency to hold hands with his male cartoon mates got another Christian group in a lather over the issue of his sexual preferences. And ultimately, of course, there 's Madonna, who was condemned by the last Pope so many times for her lapsed Catholic ways, even Celebrity Etiquette lost count ...
